alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 1:21PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Granville, northwestern Wake, Durham and west central Franklin Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 121 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near RDU International, or 8 miles northwest of Raleigh, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Butner, Franklinton, RDU International and Morrisville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
